Logs generated from network activity suc.Data: Network appliance logs, NetFlow logs, Zeek logs, full packet capture (PCAP)
Logs generated from network activity suc.Action: Inventory available network log sources (e.g., networking appliances, Zeek, PCAP). For each source, perform a time series analysis to visualize data volume over at least the last 30 days to identify collection gaps or anomalies. Use descriptive statistics to summarize key fields like protocol distribution in Zeek conn.log and the frequency of top requested domains in dns.log to establish a cursory understanding of network activity. Compare across data sources to validate collection consistency and identify individual sensor blind spots.

Logs generated from host activity such a.Data: Windows Event logs, Sysmon events, Unix auditd logs, antivirus alerts, EDR logs
Logs generated from host activity such a.Action: Catalog all available host log types (e.g., Windows Event Logs, Sysmon, EDR). For each source, perform a time series analysis to visualize data volume over at least the last 30 days to identify collection gaps or anomalies. Use descriptive statistics to summarize key fields like hostname to establish a cursory understanding of endpoint activity. Create a data coverage matrix by correlating available host log sources against the asset inventory, prioritizing critical servers and user endpoints. For key event types like process creation, use descriptive statistics (mean, median, stddev) to model normal activity per host/role and identify significant deviations that could indicate malicious activity or sensor failure.
